Description: Round-topped quartzite sandstone stela of Senseneb divided into four registers: 1 - Three rows of Hieroglyphic text. 2 - Deceased seated before a loaded table on the right, standing figure on the left; two columns of Hieroglyphic text inbetween. 3 - Three kneeling figures with lotuses separated by columns of Hieroglyphic text. 4 - Four kneeling female figures separated by columns of text.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.10)
